UBC AQ Sensor documentation¶

The UBC AQ Sensor project aims to build dispensable particular matter sensors to profile wildfire smoke plumes. The sensors will be treated as radiosondes or dropsonde to make in-situ observations of PM [1, 2.5, 10] concentrations within a wildfire smoke plume. The sensor will be attached to a Windsond radiosonde instrument that provides a vertical profile of temperature, dew point temperature wind speed, and direction. Compiling the two instruments together will hopefully provide a much-needed dataset to aid in the evaluation of smoke plume rise modeling.

Image credits US Forest Service/Public Domain (Homepage photo credit is also USFS and Public Domain) Aerial view of Woolsey Fire, November 9, 2018¶
